attributes.action: Call a judicial review into the legality of the Referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Removing legal rights people enjoy through membership of the EU without their permission, on a mere 2% difference in opinion, is morally and legally suspect.  Millions  were born into a Britain already a member of the EU and see themselves as citizens of that greater family of Europe. Evidence is growing that the motivation for this referendum was to resolve strife within a British political party not to benefit this nation and so by its very nature, it was a corrupt and misguided enterprise.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the Government to halt all procedures intended to enact the process of withdrawing the British people from the EU and to seek a Judicial Review to determine whether the calling of the Referendum exceeded the limits of Government’s power.

rejection.details:
Judicial review is a court process. The courts are responsible for it. You can read more about it here:

https://www.judiciary.gov.uk/you-and-the-judiciary/judicial-review/

If you want a judicial inquiry into the referendum, you could sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/139567
